comment.author: 25053835@N03
comment._content: We're looking for your help! Please help us identify the location in this photograph in the comments below.

comment.author: 41556429@N03
comment._content: This is the corner of 17th St. and New York Ave. NW, seen from the east side of the 500 block of 17th St. The building on the left edge of the photo is the Corcoran Gallery of Art, and the buildings on New York Ave are now a group of 1970s office buildings, including the FDIC.

comment.author: 25053835@N03
comment._content:
Thank you, corcoranspecialevents! Now that you've added more context surrounding the photo, my colleagues and I are curious to learn more about the building that's to the right. I wonder when it was demolished?  Drop us a line!

Susannah
Smithsonian Institution Archives

comment.author: 54845211@N07
comment._content: That is the Dispensary and Emergency Hospital, 1711 NY Ave NW, built 1914, Nathan C. Wyeth, architect. In 1928 the building on the right was replaced by another 9-story emergency hospital.

comment.author: 57668330@N00
comment._content: weliveindc has it - here's a 1970 image of the building from the Historical Society's collection: [catalog record]

comment.author: 25053835@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/rock_creek] Hey, rockcreek! Thank you for providing this more contemporary view and catalog record. These images should definitely be added to the Then and Now Flickr Group Pool! Susannah Smithsonian Institution Archives

comment.author: 25053835@N03
comment._content:
The title and summary have been updated for this image. Thanks to everyone for the input and identification!

Susannah
Smithsonian Institution Archives

comment.author: 37658104@N08
comment._content:
When I was a child I spent a lot of time in Emergency Hospital, in the early 1950s, under the care of Dr. Hand.  I remember my mother pointing out one Christmas the White House's National Christmas tree, through the best of the 5 half glass-walled rooms in the children's wing, the one in the middle, with the bed next to the large window.  Although I could barely see the tree it's helped me discover--with your help--where the hospital was located.  Many years later, as a student at the Corcoran, I know that spot is now Ellipse parkland.
Carol Wallwork
Centreville, VA

comment.author: 25053835@N03
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/37658104@N08] Thank you for sharing your story, Murlimews!

Susannah
